Reviews.Title: “Good - but no hot water”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: Used a room for 4 hours in transit. Room in the budget hotel, has no bathroom, use a communal toilet and shower. This is OK, but my shower had no hot water - a very cool shower! Towel supplied. The room is OK, it does the job. The light in the room gives off a strange green glow - slightly annoying. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Used swimming pool only, little bit over crowded”
Reviews.Author: TripadvNL
Reviews.Content: We used the swimming pool of this hotel before boarding our flight. The quality of the pool facilities did not match my expectation as: - the changing room of the pool was over crowded at that time - there were no lockers available - key of the lockers has no wrist strap - free included drink is only hot coffee/tea or some ice tea. No coke/sprite.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient overnight hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Colin R
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Ambassador Transit Hotel overnight several times while in transit to Indonesia. Sure the rooms are small but they are comfortable and have all the facilties you need for a short stay. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Changi airport is one of the best in the world and there are plenty of great shops, restaurants so there is plenty to do. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax during transit”
Reviews.Author: shane90
Reviews.Content: I was so tired coming back from Bandung and had to wait for the flight home in the next morning. Going out to Singapore city would be tiring. This transit hotel is easily accessible and although it is quite expensive, you can have a good rest because the terminal has a complete facility. However, after midnight there will be difficulty finding food of your choice. It has en suite for normal room and the budget rooms have the common bath and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Private and quiet place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: I booked online via their website and received a confirmation of my booking within 48hours. (SGD$76.51 - about $57 Australian for a 6 hour block of time). Easy to find on Level 3. No problems at check-in. Had room 337 twin bedded room with bathroom, large flat-screen TV and kettle and tea/coffee sachets. The TV reception was very poor on some channels, and when I went to reception and informed staff they said "Yes the quality of the TV picture isn't very good here". So I had to put up with it. The bed was narrow, but quite comfortable. The bathroom wasn't the best - Mould around the bathtub. Rather unpleasant. It was OK for 6 hours and fairly quiet. The only noise was some inconsiderate guests talking loudly in the hallway. Got a wake-up call and then a reminder call 10 mins later. I find the main airport area very noisy and the lights very bright, so this was just what I needed before my near midnight flight back to Australia. I have stayed in the Terminal 3 Transit Hotel and it was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient shoe box accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Tweetgw
Reviews.Content: I was dreading my overnight at Changi as I'd read reviews about unfriendly airport staff. so I decided instead of sleeping in the airport and having to worry about my photographic equipment etc I'd book the transit hotel. It was no frills accommodation but provided a private bathroom (communal was a cheaper option), a TV and a kettle for morning coffee or tea. The cost was S$ 78 and after a 10 hour flight from Auckland it was perfect. Bedding clean, a bed you could lie horizontal on and ... exhausted I slept so would definitely recommend if you have to stay overnight. Wake up call if you need it. Ok so there was no window, but who needs a view while sleeping?

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, rude and grotty”
Reviews.Author: Pennart
Reviews.Content: If you have a stopover in Singapore -do not waste your money staying at this t2 . It is expensive-charges are in 6 hourly blocks with additional per hour charges. There is building work being done at night so it is incredibly noisy. The bathroom had long black hairs in the tub as did the bed. Staff did not care when we informed them of our disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “small, old and noisy ~”
Reviews.Author: Susanfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. Bad sleep quality. Title says it all. All the staff in Terminal 2 (including the check-in and even waiter working in the food court and restaurants are very unfriendly... bad atmosphere there...) we nearly hated the place.... don't waste your time there.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect chance to sleep between flights”
Reviews.Author: Jcp744
Reviews.Content: Check in was confusing at first, as I was told there were no rooms free until 0930, but I pointed out I had a reservation, which was located, and I was given a room key. Not much to say about this hotel, 3 single beds, air con, tea/coffee facilities, shower, but no window. Fine for a stopover i f you want to catch sleep between flights. Overall, I would use it again, but the hotel needs to stock biscuits to go with the tea and coffee facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: nic_yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Clean tidy and spacious rooms. Perfect place to lay your head between flights. Reasonably priced and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: BorneoGeorge
Reviews.Content: It was convenient for my overnight transit to catch morning flight from Changi, plentiful of shops and eateries at Duty Free Lounge. Rooms are small and without window. Have to request for hair dryer and toothbrush/tooth paste. The carpet is a bit sticky, better to bring your own slippers. There renovation going on between 1am to 5am, the drilling sounds kept on interrupting my sleep despite using a pair of ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stopover.”
Reviews.Author: Gaja
Reviews.Content: As we had a seven hour stopover the hotel offered a chance for a bit of sleep. The room is basic no fridge but a TV. Shower was great, beds a bit small for my 6'2" frame and firm. No noise problems. I guess the excitement of our next flight to Penang in the morning meant we got little sleep and woke 1/2 hour before alarm. Flight gate was right next to Hotel along with a Starbucks which was popular for breakfast. As we were transiting, I didn't worry about changing to Singapore currency, I just used my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, comfortable rest room”
Reviews.Author: gotthebug87
Reviews.Content: I can't remember exactly if we stayed in the Terminal 1 or 2 hotel, but it was easy to find and easy to check in and sleep before our flight the next morning. I made a booking via emailing the hotel which they confirmed. If you're worried about leaving your luggage in transit, we went to the airline desk and told them that we just arrived on another airline and could our bags be transferred to our flight in the morning. All was well after they appeared at the other end the next day! Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to recover before you take your next flight”
Reviews.Author: Gilly022
Reviews.Content: Arrived Singapore airport 2.00 am needed a place for few hours for kids to get some shut eye , hotel books in 6 hr block , shower , toilet bed all that was needed all clean room . Great friendly service no booking 2 rooms well worth the money arrived fresh next day at next destination .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a long layover”
Reviews.Author: Krummi1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ambassador Transit Hotel in Terminal 2 following a night flight and a 6 hour layover. The room was clean and the bed heavenly following a red-eye flight. Generally quiet ambience to a get a good sleep. The bathroom is old though and needs an upgrade. Also, it would be good if the hotel provides slippers (to avoid stepping on the horrible carpet...yak!!!) and bathrobes as travellers usually do not carry this in their hand luggage. The hotel can be considered value for money for 60 USD for 6 hours. Thus, we rate the overall experience as average.

Reviews.Title: “So nice to get into a bed during a long layover”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: This was so convenient. We had a seven-hour layover after flying from LAX. The room was small, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop to break up your trip”
Reviews.Author: dani73Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 hours here to break up our tripnfrom Melbourne to Johannesburg. I really appreciated the opportunity to lie down on a bed and sleep uninterrupted before heading on a 11 hour flight. Very clean, beds a bit too firm but staff very obliging and placed wake up call.other passengers spent 3 hours in the terminal and were exhausted the 50$ for the room was well spent in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Good to catch up on sleep”
Reviews.Author: jl877
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be useful for our late night stopover. The check-in was quick (although it was difficult to find the actual hotel in the terminal). Wake up call was on time. It is ideal for catching up on sleep and is so much easier than leaving the airport to go to another hotel. It was quiet during the night and the room/bathroom was clean. No complaints! We also used the shower services in terminal 3 on our way home. It was just so handy to freshen up before boarding a long flight (especially as we had been around town during the day). The bathrooms were very nice and had hairdryer facilities as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for long stopover”
Reviews.Author: MelbournePoppy023
Reviews.Content: This is a great option if you have a long daytime stopover in Singapore. I had 15 hours to kill in Singapore after an early arrival and took a basic room for 6 hours (the minimum) which costs around USD30. You can add additional hours for a per hour rate. The room was perfect for a sleep (no windows!) - with a single bed with nice clean linen, a TV, and a bottle of water and towel provided. The shared showers were great - again very clean - and there is soap, shampoo etc. provided. Excellent value. You can also get rooms with private facilities but these were full when I arrived but you can prebook. Definitely worthwhile to make a long stopover less arduous.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Airport transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmyd3
Reviews.Content: Location: Ambassador Transit Hotel – Singapore Airport Remarks: Our flight arrived at 10.30pm and our departing flight due to leave 9.30am the next morning. Rather than transferring into the city at night for accommodation – the transit hotel was within the airport. It is not necessary to collect your luggage, pass through customs / immigration and it is easy to find . Room was ready on arrival, clean, quiet and excellent value for a good night’s sleep. Check-in and check-out was quick and courteous. I would recommend this hotel for travellers with extended waiting time to their next departure.

Reviews.Title: “Economical but a bit congested”
Reviews.Author: sachinmalik3
Reviews.Content: I had night layover at Changi and Transit hotel was the perfect place to catch up on the sleep and again be fresh for the morning flight. Rooms are basic but quite clean and price is quite economical. Rooms have no windows so it gives kinda claustrophobic feel. All in all a good place to spend a few hours and catch up on your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest/shower for a long transit”
Reviews.Author: khamen77
Reviews.Content: Had a long transit in Singapore. Arriving from US at about noon with the connecting flight to Bangalore, India at 8pm. I exited immigration to have lunch outside the airport (you can get to the city quite easily with the MRT train just by the terminals). Came back a few hours before and needed some rest. This transit hotel is on the upper level of Terminal 2. Each terminal may have one transit hotel. Reasonably priced for a 6 hour block. I desperately needed a place to rest, take a shower and a short nap before the next flight. I took a standard room, which comes with an attached bathroom. Economy rooms are limited, and they come with access to communal showers. The room I got was windowless, which did not matter to me since I just needed a nap. Had a TV and small desk/dresser. Smallish bathroom, with basic amenities available. Service-wise, check-in was fairly quick. You pay upfront for the room, all major credit cards accepted. The front-desk set up a wake up call for me so that I would not miss my flight. Check-out was just a quick key drop-off and I was on my way to my connecting flight!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Yeloc
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight, this is definitely the way to go if you have 6 or so hours between connections. Rooms are very basic but most importantly they are clean and everything works well. Perhaps consideration on how to reduce corridor noise and closing of doors would be a plus when trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but a bit claustropbic”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked directly via hotel email for 80s$. This is a god send after spending over 20 hours in the air. No need to pass customs, you just show up and they check you in. And the price is great for 60S$ for 6 hours (i took 8). The room had no windows, and was very basic, but good. Hardish bed, a rather industrial looking 1970s bathroom, LCD TV with loads of channels. I was jetlagged so barely slept. Had an early breakfast at an Indian restaurant (the food court opens at 6ish AM, but some open later, around 7AM). 24 hour 7/11 closeby. There is a gym but there's an additional cost. After checking out, it was just a matter of passing customs and retrieving bags from the lost and found (can be long if its busy, but took 5 minutes in my case). And I was off to Singapore using the MRT. Overall, a cheap option when entering the country late or if you have 8 hours to kill.

Reviews.Title: “The second best out of the three”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: There are 3 transit hotels inside Changi airport, this is definitely the second best. Some rooms are upgraded now, and looking 'more like a proper hotel' rather than just some rooms to crash. However, the shower isn't upgraded at all. At least it's clean!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect travel-rest situation”
Reviews.Author: cspacenz
Reviews.Content: If you want to rest for a few hours while in transit this is definitely the way to go. Whether the little budget room or the room fitted with a full bathroom the key here is getting that much needed sleep on a long haul trip. I booked for 7 hours, slept perfectly for about 5 hours and still had enough time to hop on a train, go into the city for dinner, return again on the train and catch my next flight....what more could you want. The rooms are clean and neat, beds are comfortable and shared showers and toilets where applicable are also clean and neat. Rooms options are all very well priced and staff are friendly and efficient. Noise can be an issue at times, there always seems to be some concrete drilling going on somewhere up above or down below and if any rooms are being cleaned they maybe forget that there are people asleep at any time of the day or night. Also when various people are coming and going in the nearby rooms are always so noisy....but then if you are really needing the sleep you will soon go to sleep ! Way better than paying the big dollars and having the inconvenience of going into the city for a night the Transit Hotels in all 3 terminals are a great way to go. Remember you can leave your bags at the "Left Luggage" place and go into the city for a few hours so easily. Have fun, Singapore is a great place to stop over briefly.

Reviews.Title: “Every airport should have a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: We are so lucky we stumbled on this hotel before we cleared customs. It was already after midnight, and we didn’t have reservations in the city. So, this was exactly what we needed at the right price. The room was clean and comfortable, even the bathroom! If you are coming into Singapore at an odd hour, give it a thought. Why can’t we have something like this in the Atlanta airport?

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: chilopoda2
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and efficient, the room was comfy, and the price was right. There was some minor construction going on (as other reviewers have mentioned), but it really didn't bother me. The front-desk even gave me an extra hour in the room to make up for the inconvenience. I really enjoyed having six hours of sleep, a good shower, and dinner in the comfort of my own room before continuing my journey home. Excellent place to relax between flights...highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “When you have 8 hours at the airport in the middle of the night, ths sure beats sleeping in the concourse chairs.”
Reviews.Author: JimInColorado
Reviews.Content: Nice, well-appointed room. We usually use budget accommodations, so this one was relatively luxurious and a little pricey for us, but very comfortable and certainly convenient! We arrived after midnight, flew out in the morning. The desk staff was efficient and friendly. Changi airport is big, but there are frequent trains between terminals, so no problem and the place is pretty easy to navigate. Just remember if you want to stay at this hotel between connecting flights, you do NOT go through immigration or collect checked bags, so keep your toothbrush and sleepwear in your carry-on bags.

Reviews.Title: “Every airport should have a hotel like this”
Reviews.Author: Pejola
Reviews.Content: Fantastic idea. Great sleep after arriving late at night & waiting for next flight. Rooms were nothing special, however we were only there to sleep & freshen up. Pay by the hour is a fantastic way of running a hotel like this. This hotel is so much cheaper than Crowne Plaza (which is also attached to airport) but covers off everything you need if just staying as a layover between flights. Rooms were extremely dark at night & very quiet. Just what is needed. We booked in for 9 hours. Wonderful rest. You need to be out by the time you have paid for is up or the lights & power is turned off on you. I recommend this to everyone I know who is travelling through Singapore airport. Ensure you book early as the hotel books out quiet quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Does the trick”
Reviews.Author: swglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This is a transit hotel so don't expect it to be anything fantastic. I found that all my expectations were met, the room was clean, the shower had great water pressure, lots of tea/coffee selections and an electric jug for hot water and the bed comfortable. Also I needed extra pillows so one of the housekeeping ladies gave me two extra very promptly. What I really needed was 6 hours of good sleep and this hotel provided me with that. Just a word of warning, book in advance and bring a print out of your confirmation. One guest who was checking in same time as us gave his name, the 1st receptionist told him they were fully booked (he was travelling with a young child) he didn't have a print out, but thankfully the 2nd receptionist was more on to it and knew which guests were checking in at which time, so they got their room.

Reviews.Title: “It's great !!”
Reviews.Author: singhi
Reviews.Content: Typing this from T3 and am very happy with the room. It is not the Ritz but you can have that in town if you want. You stay here for a clean room, hot shower, sleep and TV if you want. Quick easy check-in. I give it an excellent rating because it achieves exactly what we wanted. If you want more facilities stay in town - but for an airport break between flights I would definitely stay here again. Everything you need is just downstairs, free internet, restaurants and all the shopping you want. I think that you have to rate the hotel for what it is and not against such places as the Royal Orchid Sheraton etc. It is a bed and a hot shower in a quiet room and for that it is 10 out of 10. Go for it ! BUT be sure to book extra time if your connection is longer than 6 hours. We booked two lots of 6 hours and that is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Room old & tired but when you are tired too it is heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Wildman_Aussie
Reviews.Content: I have to agree the room looked very uninviting at first. We opted for a room with 2 beds (one for the child) The bathroom was clean and the shower hot and powerful The bed had seen better days and the pillows well they need not have bothered as they had seen better days too but as soon as I closed my eyes I was out until the wake up call from reception. I didnt hear an once of noise. The fire alarms started after we woke and there was no broadcast or call to say it was a false alarm but a quick call to reception confirmed we werent going to die (just as well too as an escape could have proven difficult - no windows to jump from)

Reviews.Title: “really dirty”
Reviews.Author: annuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel en-route from Bali to Manchester.The room was very grubby , the bathroom horrid - very dirty -dirt around the tiles, sink etc. The rooms need a total revamp- or a bucket of bleach to start with- .I felt really unclean after sleeping on the bed too. It is a great concept, but sadly if you want cleanlines I would recommend you avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Book in advance!”
Reviews.Author: privypurse
Reviews.Content: This is place is a lifesaver if you have a long layover in Singapore. Be sure to book at least a month in advance if you want a confirmed reservation; it fills up fast. The rooms are just fine and the price is an OK value.

Reviews.Title: “YOU PAY FOR WHAT YOU GET -NOT THAT MUCH-”
Reviews.Author: HOTELLMEMORE
Reviews.Content: I have been hesitating a lot before booking a block of 6 hours at this property during my last stop-over at Singapore’s Changi int’l airport considering some terrible reviews left by other travellers. After inspecting the room and hearing neither particular bothering noise nor experiencing specific disturbances I eventually checked in and had a peaceful rest. I must admit that T2 rooms are somewhat worn due to intense turn over but not as dirty as I thought. Bathroom compartment -less than 2 sqm- is tiny and the shower hose extremely short thus not easy to use unless you are a dwarf! I guess it has been designed that way to save water. Both check-in and check-out were expedited thanks to three reception attendants available at each time. Overall a just satisfactory stay for around SGD75. Do inspect room before checking-in to prevent major disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for transit”
Reviews.Author: Eulan
Reviews.Content: I arrived at midnight and had a 7:45am departure the next morning. That made the transit hotel exactly right. I booked a budget room for six hours. The room was clean and reasonably comfortable, but budget is truly the right adjective (very basic furniture including a single bed, no closet, no decor to speak of). Clean and more upscale baths were right down the hall. There are western style toilets in the shower rooms although that's not what you get when you follow the Toilet sign. I heard none of the promised construction noise. The wake up call came right on time. The staff were friendly and efficient at check in and check out. All in all, I was quite happy with what I got for the price. I once before stayed in an en suite room which was a lot more attractive than the budget one although it also had no window.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Li_Li
Reviews.Content: We had about 8 hours overnight between flights, so booked into this hotel for a block of 6 hours. The room was basic but adequate, particularly for a short stay. Reception automatically arranges a wake-up call for you. We had a good sleep (despite signs warning that there could be noise due to renovations) and we were grateful to be able to have a shower and feel human before getting on the next plane. It was good value for money. We were initially concerned that our luggage would go missing, since we could not pick it up and had to leave it going round and round on the carousel. (The transit hotel is before immigration, so you can't clear immigration nor pick up your bags if you want to use the hotel). But when we got to the luggage hall, we identified our luggage almost immediately. They had been set aside next to one of the conveyor belts. The only hassle was that we had to pack what we needed for the transit hotel stay into our hand luggage and this included some liquids, which we had to limit to the required 100mls per bottle and not more 1 litre and had to put them all in a resealable plastic bag.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware”
Reviews.Author: cartoon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 6 hour rest (6.30am-12.30pm)between flights overnight from melbourne to connect to Cambodia. The reception staff told us that there were renovations happening between 8am -5 pm, but we should be ok. Firstly, phone call at 7.30am awoke us, wrong room, next at 8.30am drilling, hammering, sounds of tiles or concrete dropping to floor, sounded like it was next door or above us. Unable to sleep, we left the room at 10.30am in disgust.. Why on earth could we not have been placed in another room further away? We filled out survey form and let them know what a waste of $76 it was, and of course we were too trusting in going ahead with booking as we were desperate for sleep. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the departure lounge instead”
Reviews.Author: jer21xxxx
Reviews.Content: I had a 6 hour stopover in Singapore between 1am and 7am, so I booked a room at the Terminal 2 branch of this hotel. Unlike the rest of Singapore's gleaming airport, the rooms at the transit hotel need a good, hard scrubbing. Jetlag prevented me from getting any real sleep so I spent most of the night/morning browsing the terminal shops and getting some fresh air on the outdoor terraces. Next time, I'll stay at the newly opened Crowne Plaza just outsideTerminal 3 if I have more than a 7 hour layover.

HotelInfo.Name: Ambassador Transit Hotel Terminal 2
HotelInfo.Address: Departure Transit Lounge South, Level 3, Changi Int'l Airport Terminal 2, Singapore, Singapore
